result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick S Pasterski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with C.P. unless authorized by agent.

SAFE program assessment or equivalent and follow through. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. DNA sample.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing on Sept. 12, 2016 
Includes 16CF14, 16CM1407, 14CM513, and 14CM1406.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:26 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF14, 16CM1407, 14CM513, AND 14CM1406. 
State appears by ADA Matt Adrian; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Anne Renc.  

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF14 AND 16CM1407. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.

State moves to: 
In 16CF14: Ct. 2 (Battery/DA/DA Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                 : Ct. 3 (DC/DA/DA Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 16CM1407: Ct. 2 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Temporary Restraining Order/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 16CF14: Ct. 1 (Strangulation and Suffocation/DA/DA Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 16CM1407: Ct. 1 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Temporary Restraining Order/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises deft of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & deft guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 16CF14 AND 16CM1407 AND SENTENCING ON REV IN 14CM513 AND 14CM1406. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CF14: Ct. 1>>5.5 years imprisonment - 2.5 years IC and 3 years ES - CONDITIONS of ES: SAFE program assessment or equivalent and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with C.P unless authorized by agent; payment of unpaid costs in 14CM513 and 14CM1406; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including DA surcharge. 
In 16CM1407: Ct. 1>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - CONDITIONS of ES: SAFE program assessment or equivalent and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with C.P unless authorized by agent; payment of unpaid costs in 14CM513 and 14CM1406; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including DA surcharge. 
In 14CM513: Ct. 2>>90 days MCJ. 
In 14CM1406: Ct. 2>>90 days MCJ. 
                       : Ct. 3>>9 months MCJ. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 

COURT finds the deft entitled to: 
In 16CF14>>249 days sentence credit. 
In 16CM1407>>NO days sentence credit. 
In 14CM513>>250 days sentence credit. 
In 14CM1406>>250 days sentence credit. 

COURT finds the deft NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 

COURT remands deft into custody for transport to WSPS. 

Adj: 1:53 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on July 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:31 am 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Anne Renc. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set dates. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 9:33 am

records.addlTxt: **CO-SIGNED BY MOTHER**$2,500.00 SIGNATURE W/ FIRST $500.00 CASH. Absolute sobriety. Take medications as prescribed. No controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and only use in amount prescribed. MCSD police escort to retrieve any personal belongings. No contact with C.P.-NON WAIVABLE. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
